properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters of Northern USVI and Culebra out 10 NM; Caribbean Waters of Puerto Rico from 10 NM to 17N; Coastal Waters of Northern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Mona Passage Southward to 17N; Coastal Waters of Southern USVI, Vieques, and Eastern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Coastal Waters of Southern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Coastal Waters OF Northwestern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Atlantic Waters of Puerto Rico AND USVI from 10 NM to 19.5N; Anegada Passage Southward to 17N
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued January 8 at 3:53PM AST until January 12 at 8:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
...Strong easterly winds will cause hazardous seas...

.Hazardous seas are expected across the regional waters starting
on Thursday due to a strong surface high pressure producing fresh
to strong trade winds. Hazardous seas will continue through at
least next week.

* WHAT...East winds 20 to 25 kt with gusts up to 35 kt and seas
7 to 12 feet expected.

* WHERE...Local Atlantic and Caribbean waters and passages.

* WHEN...From 2 PM Thursday to 8 PM AST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Conditions will be hazardous to small craft.
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should avoid navigating in hazardous conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THURSDAY TO 8 PM AST SUNDAY
